data.title: Livonia Partners
data.text:
The merger of Thermory, the leading producer of thermally modified wood, and Ha Serv, Europeâs largest manufacturer of sauna materials and ready-made saunas, has led to the creation of a global market leader in these segments.

The merged companyâs multifaceted production capacity provides an excellent opportunity to reap the benefits of global trends.

The use of plastic, chemically treated wood and other environmentally harmful products is increasingly coming under pressure among architects and builders. Thermory is the largest producer of thermally modified, environmentally responsible hardwood in the world. Its products are directed at the expanding thermal wood market with vast potential to capture higher share of the 4-5 billion euro decking and cladding market. The merged companyâs turnover is approaching 70 million euro by the end of the year.

It was difficult choosing a name to continue under and we had to use outside advice.â

The effective sales teams of Thermory and Ha Serv have led to the expansion of thermally modified wood and sauna products worldwide. âWe have been competitors for over 20 years. Together we can think bigger and faster develop our various business lines,â added Meelis Kajandu.

The merged company has two production units located in Estonia and one located in Finland. The company also has sawmills in Estonia and Belarus and a subsidiary in the United States. Thermory employs more than 500 people.

Thermoryâs management board will continue with two members: Johann Sulling and Marko Kevvai. According to Johann Sulling, the merger creates excellent opportunities for long-term growth through expanding the variety of product and market opportunities. âEverybody wins! 1+1 adds up to more than 2 in our case,â said Sulling. Thermoryâs second board member Marko Kevvai added, âWe came to the understanding that if you want to move forward fast, then go alone, but if you want to go far, itâs better to go together.â
